item.title: How to count NULLs with SQL and R
item.description: When representing no values, NULL and NA are used in SQL and R, respectively. Be careful that NULL in R is not the same one as NULL in SQL. Using SQL select count(*) [Number of Null Salaries] from EmP where Salary is NULL Using base R ```r load the data into dataframe install.packages(“RODBC”) library(RODBC) conn <- odbcConnect(“localhost”) Emp <- sqlQuery(conn,“select * from capstone.dbo.Emp”)
